meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6781.

td.p: Josh McIlvain, a home health aide from Syracuse, New York
Sofi Albizuri, a writer and mom from Miami, Florida
Arthur Chu, a compliance analyst and voiceover artist from Broadview Heights, Ohio (whose 4-day cash winnings total $102,800)

tr.td: (Alex: What will the "I" stand for in each of our clues?)
THE NATIONAL MUSEUM OF AMERICAN HISTORY

because this important national document had been composed on it

The first transcontinental car trip was made by Horatio Nelson Jackson in this 1903 Winton at a time when America had few roads and little support for cars; so, whenever he had a breakdown & needed repairs, he would often have to rely on these workers that the automobile would soon put out of business')

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: [After reveals] Frederick Douglass said of this man, "I could live for the slave, but he could die for him." He was referring to [*].)
JoshWho is Abraham Lincoln?
$5,800
SofiWho is Lincoln?
$7,000
ArthurWho is William Lloyd Garrison?
$10,000
John Brown')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'Frederick Douglass said this man\'s "zeal in the cause of my race was far greater than mine"')

tr.td: Frederick Douglass said this man's "zeal in the cause of my race was far greater than mine"

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
